name.en: Special topic: Free radical biology and medicine
name.ch: 專題研究：自由基生物醫學

goal.ch:
活性氧屬(reactive oxygen species, ROS)或氧自由基(oxygen free radicals)。此外，致癌物質、藥物、污染物質、紫外線、X光、電磁波等外來物質也會導致自由基的產生。而人的情緒的緊繃如生氣、緊張等亦會產生自由基。自由基可能藉由接觸輻射及有毒化學物、過度日光曝曬，或經由不同的代謝作用，例如分解貯存的脂肪。自由基在生物細胞可誘導產生訊息傳遞作用，過量則可損傷
DNA，protein，lipid 等造成。本課程期許學生了解生物醫學相關研究，
學習思考和研究方法。“
以及大數據分析課程本計畫會搭配免費線上平台Datacamp(教學方案)，讓學生以自學之方法可以在家自行練習課堂所學技巧，透過平台可以隨時監控學生進度，並且在課餘時間開設工作坊可以讓同學們詢問問題以及協助同學們進行專題研究。此平台擁有即時回饋功能，比起以往授課學生必須回家花費大量時間找答案，可以大幅縮減學生對於程式學習的障礙。
goal.en:
“The translation is:

“Reactive oxygen species (ROS) or oxygen free radicals. In addition, external substances such as carcinogens, drugs, pollutants, ultraviolet rays, X-rays, and electromagnetic waves can also lead to the generation of free radicals. Emotional stress, such as anger or nervousness, can also produce free radicals. Free radicals can be generated by exposure to radiation, toxic chemicals, excessive sunlight, or through various metabolic processes, such as the breakdown of stored fats. In biological cells, free radicals can induce signal transduction, but excessive amounts can damage DNA, proteins, and lipids. This course aims to help students understand biomedical-related research and learn critical thinking and research methods.

As for the big data analysis course, this plan will be paired with the free online platform Datacamp (teaching program), allowing students to practice the skills learned in class at home through self-study. The platform enables real-time monitoring of student progress, and workshops outside of class hours are available for students to ask questions and assist with their research projects. The platform provides real-time feedback, significantly reducing the barriers to learning programming compared to traditional teaching methods, where students had to spend a lot of time finding answers on their own.
